articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Bangladesh's army chief will meet student protest leaders on Tuesday as the country awaits the formation of a new government a day after Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina resigned and fled the country following a violent uprising against her rule.
articles.title: Bangladesh awaits interim government, army chief to meet protesters

articles.author: Andrea Shalal, Jarrett Renshaw, Richard Cowan
articles.description: Democratic presidential candidate Kamala Harris selected Minnesota Governor Tim Walz to be her running mate on Tuesday, choosing a progressive policy champion and a plain speaker from America's heartland to help win over rural, white voters, according to sources familiar with the matter.
articles.title: Tim Walz: Kamala Harris picks Minnesota governor for vice president

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The leader of Hezbollah on Tuesday pledged a "strong and effective" response to the killing of its military commander by Israel last week and said it would act either alone or with its regional allies.
articles.title: Hezbollah pledges strong response to Israel over killing of military chief, alone or with allies

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israeli forces killed at least four people in the volatile city of Jenin in the occupied West Bank, medics said on Tuesday, following a night of violence in which four others were killed in clashes near Tubas, close to the border with Jordan.
articles.title: Israeli forces kill at least eight Palestinians in West Bank clashes, medics say

articles.author: Sachin Ravikumar, Kate Holton
articles.description: The British government has increased its prison capacity to help tackle violent, week-long anti-immigrant riots that have prompted a growing number of countries to warn their citizens about the dangers of travelling in Britain.
articles.title: No end to UK protests as government expands jail capacity

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russian forces have thwarted a Ukrainian attempt to penetrate the border in Russia's Kursk region, the interim governor of the region said on Tuesday.
articles.title: Russian forces thwart Ukrainian attempt to penetrate the border, regional governor says

articles.author: Ruma Paul, Sudipto Ganguly
articles.description: Nobel laureate Muhammad Yunus, the pioneer of the global microcredit movement who could shepherd Bangladesh's new interim government, was an arch foe of Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina who has resigned and fled the country.
articles.title: Nobel laureate Muhammad Yunus was arch foe of ousted Bangladesh PM Hasina

articles.author: David Latona, Belén Carreño
articles.description: The parliament of Spain's Catalonia region is expected to elect a new leader this week, although the event may be upstaged by the return of its former leader from self-imposed exile, despite a pending warrant for his arrest.
articles.title: Spain's Catalonia to elect new leader as ex-leader Puigdemont's arrest looms

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Several U.S. personnel were injured in an attack against a military base in Iraq on Monday, three U.S. officials told Reuters, as concerns in the region mounted following last week's killing of senior members of militant groups Hamas and Hezbollah.
articles.title: Exclusive: US personnel wounded in attack against base in Iraq, officials say

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Venezuela's Defense Minister Vladimir Padrino on Tuesday reaffirmed the military's "absolute loyalty" to President Nicolas Maduro, amid an on-going dispute over the country's contested presidential election results.
articles.title: Venezuela defense minister reaffirms military's loyalty to Maduro
